Great game, a much more chilled apprach to VR gaming than most games offer.
However, I feel users such as myself who didn't think to check if the game was any different on Steam, and thus, didn't realise that using the Oculus store variant   would mean missing out on workshop/mod support. 
Devs should reduce the cost slightly on the Oculus platform or at least advertise on the Oculus store page that users can just head to steam, pay the same price, and get mod support included... (Or, even better, bring a mod tool to the Oculus version)

For now, do buy the game, it's a great way to relax! Just, don't buy it on the Oculus store...

review_feedback: Hi swatking9! Sorry you're having trouble. Do you have both the headset and the monitor connected to your GPU? Sometimes the problem you're describing can happen if the headset is connected to an HDMI output on the motherboard, instead of the GPU. If that doesn't help, feel free to follow up by e-mailing me at hello@lumbernauts.com. Thanks!

one_reviews_text: I love the idea and style of the game; however, I think the game needs a major update that would introduce more buildings, vehicles, and people. Besides that, the game is worth every penny if you're the creative type.

review_feedback: Hi Nick, sorry about that. Do you know when the game stopped working for you? Feel free to reach out at hello@lumbernauts.com for help. Thanks!

one_reviews_text:
Starting with the bad, the controls are very unintuitive, working completely differently from other creative apps. Once you get some familiarity, it works perfectly fine; I just find some of the developer's choices a bit strange. There are also one or two small bugs (e.g. when you copy items, it will try to copy the last item you moved rather than the one you have selected.

Once I was over the usability issues and learned all the basics, it was just fantastic fun. There is a ton of content and those with big imaginations will really be in their element. Taking photos was quite easy, though it would be nice to have some extra controls. The omission most obvious is zoom/FOV, and from my own dev experience, I imagine that wouldn't be too difficult to add. Focus and exposure controls would also rock. As it stands though, this is a time-sucker where you can just spend ages being creative, even without an end-point in mind. Absolutely love it and this type of thing is where VR really shines, as doing this in 2D with a mouse and keyboard would be so much more difficult.

With what we have here, we can make great storyboard stuff, but I would gladly hand over more cash for a version which allowed us to create movies. Simple keyframing and tweening would be really awesome, though I do get that this would be a big undertaking. Just dreaming :)

Hi salzziny! 

Thanks! And thanks for the suggestions. Unfortunately, Steam Workshop is a proprietary platform and not available with Oculus Home. As for toys, I'd never even thought about it! I'd guess probably not in the near term. Thanks again!

one_reviews_text: You should add a workshop so we can download costom items for making scenes

Was a bit frustrated the first time I played because I couldn't figure out how to change the buildings menu and browse the other selections, like the cars or people. Second time I played I actually hit the thumbstick on my opposite hand accidently. Ah! You change the menu using the thumbstick of the opposite hand you're using to view the menu! Easy when you know how. Seriously, this needs to be in a concise tutorial. The existing "tutorial" tips are not very helpful. 

Apart from this, I was blown away with this game. There are countless items to choose from if you want to create your own scene. I hope the devs add more items in the future. Or, at least make expansion packs. This game is kind of The Sims meets Legoland. The interface gives you the flexibility to enlarge or zoom the scene. The items are easily placed and picked up. Most of all, it has the one quality that always keeps me coming back to games like Minecraft, Spore or The Sims. The freedom to create. The artist in me can't resist a chance to create.  This game is worth every penny, as far as I'm concerned.
I finally got the game working, but other people have objects that I dont. Is there an update I need, because it isnt Saying anything about one in my notifications center.
review_feedback:
Hi richardlannon!

Glad you got it going. Just in case you aren't familiar, when you open up the inventory (by turning one hand palm up) you can scroll left and right through items in the current category, but you can also change the category by scrolling up or down. To scroll, either swipe the opposite hand with your palm facing the direction you want to scroll or use the thumbstick. 

The other thing that might be happening is that you're seeing videos of players that uploaded custom content using Steam Workshop, which unfortunately isn't supported on Oculus Home. Hope that helps.
